message.entry: Unable to apply method to data variable ''{0}''.
Invalid grouping variables.
Grouping variables function handle must return a logical scalar.
Invalid data variables.
Data variables function handle must return a logical scalar.
First argument must be a vector, matrix, table, or timetable.
Grouping variable cannot be specified as a function handle.
Grouping variables and data matrix must have same number of rows.
Unable to apply method to data column {0}.
Unable to concatenate results from applying specified method to data columns.
Method must be ''zscore'', ''norm'', ''meancenter'', ''rescale'', ''meanfill'', ''linearfill'', or a function handle.
Not enough input arguments. Specify a valid method.
The specified method must return a scalar or have the same number of rows as the method input.
The number of binning schemes must be compatible with the number of grouping variables.
Binning scheme is not supported when grouping variable is empty.
Invalid binning scheme.
Unable to apply binning method ''{0}'' to grouping variable ''{1}''.
Unable to apply binning method to grouping variable ''{0}''.
Unable to apply binning method to all grouping variables. Use a cell array or string array to specify a binning method for each grouping variable, with 'none' to indicate no binning.
Parameter name must be ''ReplaceValues'' or ''IncludedEdge''.
Incorrect number of input arguments. Parameter names and values must occur in pairs.
''IncludedEdge'' is only supported when binning scheme is specified.
Function handle data variables are not supported for code generation.
Transformation method must be constant for code generation.
Data variables must be constant for code generation.
Binning methods are not supported for datetime or duration data for code generation.
When the binning method is a character vector, string, or cell array of character vectors, it must be constant for code generation.
Transformation methods returning cell arrays are not supported for code generation.
